paper_metadata.title: Clinical Penetrance of the Transthyretin V122I Variant in Older Black Patients With Heart Failure: The SCAN‐MP Study
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the TTR gene variant V122I, including penetrance data and individual records.

patients.phenotype: Heart failure, with some cases of ATTR-CM

individual_records.evidence_sentence: The median age of those with penetrant ATTR‐CM was 82 years.
The median age for carriers without penetrant ATTR‐CM was 66 years.

functional_data.summary: V122I carriers with ATTR-CM showed more advanced heart failure than those without.

variants.segregation_data: Does not segregate with disease in families as it is a population variant.
variants.additional_notes: The study emphasizes that genotype alone is insufficient for diagnosis.
key_quotes: The phenotypic penetrance of V122I was 39% (95% CI, 17–64).
Among older Black individuals with HF and increased left ventricular wall thickness, of those with V122I, the phenotypic penetrance of ATTR‐CM was 39%.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data regarding the TTR gene variant V122I was successfully extracted.
